title: The Archers with tractors - but no actors
text:
Listeners have long loved its jaunty theme tune and bucolic depiction of country life.

Now the producers of The Archers have created a spin-off episode that features all the soothing sounds of Ambridge village – without the voices of the actors.

The 'soundscape' will include the background noises of 'wind rustling through the trees' and the gentle lowing of 'nearby cattle herds', as well as the inevitable passing tractors.

Now the producers of The Archers have created a spin-off episode that features all the soothing sounds of Ambridge village – without the voices of the actors

The ten-minute episode will be set on Brookfield Farm, at the gate into Marney's Field, on a 'quiet Saturday afternoon'.

It will not air on Radio 4 but is available this morning by subscribing to the show's podcast on the BBC Sounds app.

Jeremy Howe, editor of The Archers, said: 'For ten tranquil minutes, just enjoy the magic of the Ambridge countryside.'

The soundscape follows the success of 'slow TV' shows, such as a two-hour canal boat journey shot in real time.
